page.title: 03Country life in Frogmore.
page.content: {From my garden I can see a farmer in {his tractor and he waves to me. {Sometimes I hear a huntsman shooting {rabbits in the fields. Frogmore has {lots of bridle paths. My brother has {two horses called Bonnie and Rowan {which he takes on the bridle paths. He {has two fields near a wood which is at {the top of a steep hill. We sometimes {go in the wood to collect sticks for {fire wood. The creek has lots of boats {on it. The other day we saw some swans {by the bridge and they had some fluffy {little cygnets. If you go out on your {boat you can see an abandoned old {house. If you go up to the house you {can see it has a slide and swing and {nice countryside around it. There is a {lot of wild life there such as {squirrels, many kinds of birds and {wild flowers. We often see a Buzzard {swooping down. }
